extractions.description: This paper addresses the performance deterioration of Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) models when tested on out-of-domain datasets, specifically in whole slide images (WSIs) for medical diagnosis. The authors propose the Retrieval-AugMented MIL (RAM-MIL) framework, which integrates Optimal Transport (OT) for nearest neighbor retrieval. This method improves both in-domain and out-of-domain performance by reducing the intrinsic dimension of input features and enhancing model generalization.

type.justification: The paper presents empirical evaluations on WSI datasets, demonstrating the performance of the proposed RAM-MIL framework.
type.quote: Empirical evaluations conducted on WSI classification demonstrate that the proposed RAM-MIL framework achieves state-of-the-art performance in both in-domain scenarios, where the training and retrieval data are in the same domain, and more crucially, in out-of-domain scenarios, where the (unlabeled) retrieval data originates from a different domain.

name.justification: The paper primarily deals with image data, specifically whole slide images (WSIs) for medical diagnosis, which falls under the field of Computer Vision.
name.quote: Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) ... applied across various domains, e.g., medical diagnosis based on whole slide images (WSIs).

name.justification: The primary application domain discussed in the paper is medical diagnosis using whole slide images (WSIs), making it a subfield of Medical Image Analysis.
name.quote: MIL models when tested on an out-of-domain test set, exemplified by WSIs sourced from a novel hospital.

name.justification: The paper focuses on Multiple Instance Learning (MIL), which is a form of weakly supervised learning.
name.quote: Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) is a crucial weakly supervised learning method.

name.justification: RAM-MIL is the primary model proposed in the paper.
name.quote: This paper introduces the Retrieval-AugMented MIL (RAM-MIL) framework.

is_contributed.justification: RAM-MIL is a new model contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: This paper introduces the Retrieval-AugMented MIL (RAM-MIL) framework.

is_executed.justification: The model is executed and evaluated through various experiments in the paper.
is_executed.quote: We train the final classifier using the merged representation... Our empirical study confirms that RAM-MIL effectively reduces the intrinsic dimensionality of the input feature space...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the performance of RAM-MIL with other state-of-the-art MIL methods.
is_compared.quote: Our empirical study confirms that RAM-MIL... surpassing existing MIL methods in both in-domain and out-of-domain settings.
